revised_title: High Energy Solar Particles: Transport Processes, Coronal Dependence, and Charge Composition
tldr: This article discusses three aspects of high-energy solar particles: transport processes along magnetic flux tubes, solar longitudinal dependence of intensity profiles, and charge composition measurements. The authors explore how these aspects provide information on particle motion in the corona, the large-scale coronal magnetic structure, and the composition and ionization state of the acceleration region. They also analyze the physics behind particle transport, including diffusion, acceleration, and the interplay between magnetic and electric fields.
